text: folks who are financially savvy will encourage people to invest and start young good that's a good start the problem with it is without good direction that early start can just perpetually set you back and that's the bad part of it a lot of younger traders do not think through what they're doing and essentially they just start losing money and when you lose money early on you're really starting to take your future wealth away from yourself and losing some money is natural it's going to happen to anybody who's starting to invest but there's got to be a line in the sand somewhere where you realize that you're being counterproductive so i wanted to run through a couple things that really i guess i would call it advice to myself if i were to sit my younger self down that's first starting and really i guess that would apply to you know other folks who are younger so when i started at 17 the very first thing that i would tell myself is learn to take paper trading seriously and i know that it's a pain point for a lot of folks it's very difficult to take paper trading seriously for this reason or that reason when i look back at it if you can't find the discipline to take paper trading seriously you're gonna have a hard time with most of this so that's one of the very first things i would tell myself is learn

text: a ton of strategies just a ton of them um butterflies calendars vertical spreads iron condors short puts like like pretty much everything and a lot of that would have been better suited in a paper account that's what i do now is when i'm testing a new strategy i don't immediately go live with it i'll do it in a paper account for a little while to see if i like it and can develop a good outline for it and for whatever reason when i first started trading i was doing all that live and pissing a lot of money away doing it was stupid careful luckily i was really careful with size and i was very uh judicious in maintaining good size so that was helpful but otherwise it was still generally a waste of capital and that is another good note if you find yourself not not focusing on size or risk allocation it's something that's worthwhile the last thing that i would say um that i really would kind of tell my younger self is don't focus just on the investing markets like stock stock markets i found that a really key component to my ability to develop wealth at a relatively young age was spreading into other business ventures and you kind of come across different opportunities that way the market is a really helpful way to you know continue to enhance your wealth but like i said if you're starting with a relatively
